results.doc_title: [Please Prio] Charge@Checkout OWL: Refund & Cancellation FLow - 2025/12/17 17:18 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Discuss and resolve issues with the refund and cancellation flow for Charge@Checkout orders in the OWL system

decisions.what: Target process for pre-cutoff cancellations is to mark order as 'not shipped' and cancel payment
decisions.context: This replicates Bob's behavior and is already known by agents. Moving away from Bob system to AL system.

decisions.what: Accept known limitation that refunds will only occur after cutoff even with bug fix
decisions.context: Maximum 3 weeks wait time. This is manageable and won't affect too many customers.

decisions.what: Cancellations do not happen via ART (Error Reporting Tool)
decisions.context: Clarification on agent processes for handling cancellations

action_items.task: Deploy bug fix for automatic refund reconciliation to production
Adapt OWL to call endpoint and expose transaction information in proper form
Notify team once bug fix is deployed to production
Double check with live order to verify the fix works properly

key_points: Target state involves marking orders as 'not shipped' and canceling payment via AL system
Bug identified in payments domain affecting automatic refund reconciliation for process out payment provider
Bug affects CNC (Charge at Checkout) orders and partially paid orders requiring automatic refunds
Without fix, refunds only occur after cutoff even if delivery is canceled
Fix is being tested in staging and expected to move to production despite delivery freeze
Agents are already trained on the target process from Bob system
Payment status and refund visibility for CNC orders before and after cutoff needs clarification

blockers.issue: Bug in payments domain - missing automatic refund reconciliation configuration for process out
blockers.impact: Refunds only received after cutoff, even if delivery is canceled pre-cutoff
blockers.status: Fix in staging, deployment expected tomorrow

blockers.issue: Delivery freeze potentially blocking production deployment
blockers.status: Team expects to deploy despite freeze

blockers.issue: Transaction visibility in OWL needs additional work
blockers.impact: Agents may not have clear visibility of refund status
blockers.status: Identified as second action point, not yet addressed

follow_ups: Verify bug fix works with live orders after production deployment
Address transaction visibility in OWL for better agent experience
Monitor impact on customers during the 3-week maximum refund delay period

entities.name: OWL
entities.context: System being used for order cancellation and refund flow, needs adaptation to call endpoint for transaction information

entities.name: AL system
entities.context: Target system for handling pre-cutoff order cancellations and refunds, replacing Bob

entities.name: Bob
entities.context: Previous system whose behavior is being replicated; agents already trained on its processes

entities.name: process out
entities.context: New payment service provider with missing automatic refund reconciliation configuration causing the bug

entities.name: ART (Error Reporting Tool)
entities.context: Tool that is NOT used for cancellations, clarified during meeting

entities.name: CNC (Charge at Checkout)
entities.context: Order type primarily affected by the refund reconciliation bug

entities.name: Shishir Mishra
entities.context: Confirmed target process for cancellations and clarified agent procedures

entities.name: Gangadharan Khoteeswarun (Ganga)
entities.context: Identified the bug, responsible for testing and deploying the fix to production

entities.name: Michael Lucero
entities.context: Noted earlier confusion about marking orders as 'shipped' vs 'not shipped'

entities.name: Hagag
entities.context: Explained difference between canceling an order and canceling a payment operation

entities.name: Nikita Gorshkov
entities.context: Participated in decisions about addressing issues and managing customer impact

results.meeting_purpose: Final review of the 2026 Q1 Yearly Plan for the Consumer Mega-Alliance, including discussion of strategic priorities, resource allocation, and cross-functional alignment

decisions.what: Create AOV-focused squad in Q2 with dedicated KPI
decisions.context: Self-funded squad to drive average order value growth after rolling out personalized core journey in Q1

decisions.what: Prioritize menu ranking rollout: P500 readiness Q4/Q1, Penguin for Factor US, then INTL markets
decisions.context: Menu ranking models prioritized alongside Elysium app features, with fallback to Penguin Harp personalization for INTL if needed

decisions.what: Decouple forecasting from personalization models
decisions.context: Enable independent iteration through technical interfaces, assess organizational impact in Q1-Q2

decisions.what: Reserve 20% engineering IC capacity for legacy loyalty program maintenance
decisions.context: Maintain existing program while implementing new vendor-based loyalty program launching first in US

decisions.what: Pause Programs on Factor funnel for peak due to negative results
decisions.context: Will partner with Commercial and New Programs hire to design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships in Q2

decisions.what: Prioritize recipe bridge feature for Q4/Q1 in Project 5M
decisions.context: Addresses behavioral gap where users save recipes but rarely act on them, indicating friction in execution

decisions.what: Defer variable pricing to Q3, add to Market Innovation squad backlog
decisions.context: Urgently requested by markets but ownership needs definition as pricing moves to growth MA

action_items.task: Roll out Elysium (new store and homepage) with merchandising widgets, recommendation widgets, search, and popular/trending features
Share prioritization framework for Project 5M with detailed methodology
Define technical interfaces for decoupling forecasting from personalization
Sign off on Factor requirements integration into Market Innovation backlog
Define long-term ownership for variable pricing before initiation
Strengthen RAF program with foundational fixes (data visibility, customer experience, operational agility)
Design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships for Factor
action_items.owner: Alison Ryan (with Commercial and New Programs hire)

action_items.task: Expand Penguin personalization to INTL markets (HF-UK, HF-CA, CP-CA, HF-ANZ, HF-BNL, HF-DKSE, HF-DEAT)
Merge Factor backlog with Market Innovation squad list
action_items.owner: Jama Musse and Annie Meininghaus (with Adam Park)

key_points: Integration of menu expansion plans, personalization rollouts, and app features through Elysium and menu ranking models
Project 5M prioritization based on behavioral gap analysis showing users save recipes but don't act on them
Reconciliation of marketing RAF plan with tech yearly plan to address growth target gaps
Variable pricing as urgently requested feature by markets
Factor requirements integration and transition planning
Loyalty strategy evolution from legacy to new vendor-based program
AOV growth strategy through dedicated squad formation
Personalization model rollout prioritization across markets
blockers: Gap between Marketing and Consumer growth targets for RAF program
Negative results from Programs on Factor funnel requiring pause during peak
Need to define long-term ownership for variable pricing as pricing moves to growth MA
Technical dependencies making RAF program difficult to optimize
follow_ups: Detailed methodology walkthrough for Project 5M prioritization framework if requested
Organizational impact assessment after forecasting/personalization decoupling validation
AOV-focused squad establishment post-Q2
Factor Programs transition plan execution in Q2
Loyalty Strategy SMT Shareout review

results.doc_title: Influencer MP Sprint Review - 2025/12/04 16:24 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Sprint review for Influencer MP project focusing on creator research status, customer validation planning, and prototype critique

decisions.what: Concept validation prototype will use a pitch deck to guide conversation and feature critique
decisions.context: Decided during discussion of validation approach

decisions.what: Research transitioning to focus on cookbook authors and higher-level influencers
decisions.context: Based on insights from initial five creator interviews

decisions.what: Next phase will focus on customer interviews with HelloFresh prospects actively engaging with food content on social media
decisions.context: Building on signals from unmoderated tests and survey showing inspiration execution gap

action_items.task: Move creator interviews into concept validation phase
Continue recruitment focusing on larger influencers
Conduct customer interviews to understand service usage, perceived value, and trust barriers
Communicate strategy decisions and research needs to Marc and Andrea

key_points: Five creator interviews completed covering creators up to 1.2 million followers with consistent insights
Cookbook author showed no conflict using cookbook recipes on platform for exposure and aligned with commission-based compensation
Creators interested in data points: user interests, popular ingredients, cooking time, and site traffic
Customers might not understand if HelloFresh is not vetting recipes and may blame platform or creator for bad recipes
Survey showed significant inspiration execution gap among customers
Pricing model discussion: creators setting own margin vs. tiered cost-plus approach
Research prioritization decisions based on amount of work needed and clarity required in specific areas
blockers: Uncertainty about customer understanding of recipe vetting in Amazon-style marketplace approach
Need for clarity on trust and quality barriers from customer perspective
Unclear strategy direction affecting research planning and resource allocation
follow_ups: Deeper probing into creator use of trends and vetting expectations
Understanding how customers would use service (special occasions vs. daily purchases)
Feature prioritization based on concept validation results
Potential for Katheryn to continue research support beyond initial timeline depending on needs
Testing requirements to be identified once strategy decisions are finalized

entities.name: Annette MvdE
entities.context: Meeting leader, project owner making strategy decisions

entities.name: Katheryn Eckles
entities.context: Lead researcher conducting creator and customer interviews

entities.name: Ian Brooks
entities.context: Participant favoring pricing model where creators set their own margin, limited to 45 minutes participation

entities.name: Sameer Doda
entities.context: Proposed tiered, cost-plus pricing approach

entities.name: Linnea Siersma
entities.context: Favoring pricing model where creators set their own margin

entities.name: Marc
entities.context: Decision maker for research resource allocation and project continuation

entities.name: Andrea
entities.context: Decision maker for research resource allocation and project continuation

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Platform being developed for influencer marketplace, target for customer prospect interviews

entities.name: Influencer MP
entities.context: Main project being reviewed in sprint, focused on creator-customer marketplace

entities.name: Berlin
entities.context: Referenced as location with different approach of rolling out features weekly without testing

results.doc_title: Refund from Owl for C@C - 2025/12/08 13:15 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: To investigate and resolve refund failures for customers in the 'charge at checkout' (CSC) experiment when processing initial orders through the Owl system

decisions.what: Use the Orders tab refund button instead of error reporting tab for refunds
decisions.context: The Orders tab uses the updated refund service endpoint like Bob, while error reporting may use an older RabbitMQ topic method

decisions.what: Train customer care agents to use Orders tab for refunds and avoid error reporting tab
decisions.context: To ensure consistent refund processing using the correct endpoint

decisions.what: Not to reopen Bob for all customer care agents on a market basis
decisions.context: Switching Bob access on/off affects 1500 agents at once and cannot be easily done on a market-specific basis without significant effort

action_items.task: Create a new live order and attempt refund via Orders tab with screen recording
Issue refund and then cancel the order, documenting all steps
Update team on results via channel
Investigate with team responsible for error reporting to ensure it works the same as new refund button
Consider involving Ganga or Diana from payment operations team to confirm Bob and Owl use same refund endpoint
Communicate refund process (use Orders tab, not error reporting) to CC team via good job channel

key_points: Refunds failing for customers in 'charge at checkout' (CSC) experiment for initial orders, but working for BAU customers charged at cutoff
CSC allocation happens on payments page and is not visible in Owl system
Only 10% of customers allocated to experiment, with 5% getting CSC, making it difficult to identify affected cases
Bob and Owl supposedly use same refund service endpoint, but behavior differs
Orders tab in Owl uses updated refund service (like Bob), while error reporting tab may use older RabbitMQ topic method
Owl does not display customer experiment allocation, making it hard for agents to identify CSC customers
Customer care structure: L1 agents are first responders who escalate to L2 payment teams for resolution
Bob access affects 1500 agents at once and cannot be easily toggled per market
blockers: CSC allocation not visible in Owl, making it difficult for customer care agents to identify affected customers
Only 5% of 10% of customers are in CSC experiment, making it hard to find examples to test
Lack of UIDs or CIDs from Star being passed to customer agents
Inconsistency between refund mechanisms in different Owl tabs (Orders vs error reporting)
Cannot easily enable Bob access on a market-specific basis due to system limitations
follow_ups: Verify whether Bob and Owl actually use the exact same refund endpoint
Investigate why error reporting tab may be using different refund method than Orders tab
Consider making experiment allocation visible in Owl for customer care agents
Explore passing UIDs or CIDs from Star to customer agents for better tracking
Test if issue is systemic or isolated by attempting refund on new live order
Confirm training approach for L1 and L2 customer care agents on proper refund process

entities.name: Beatrice Dimarucut
entities.context: Reported the refund issue and will test live order refund

entities.name: Shishir Mishra
entities.context: Discussed technical aspects and agent access decisions

entities.name: Hagag
entities.context: Explained technical differences between Orders tab and error reporting tab refund mechanisms

entities.name: Nikita Gorshkov
entities.context: Listed as meeting invitee

entities.name: Ganga
entities.context: Payment operations team member who could confirm endpoint usage

entities.name: Diana
entities.context: Payment operations team member who could confirm endpoint usage

entities.name: Owl
entities.context: System where refunds are failing for CSC customers; has Orders tab and error reporting tab with different refund mechanisms

entities.name: Bob
entities.context: System where refunds work correctly; uses same refund service endpoint as Owl Orders tab

entities.name: CSC (Charge at Checkout)
entities.context: Experiment where customers are charged at checkout instead of cutoff; experiencing refund failures

entities.name: BAU (Business As Usual)
entities.context: Standard process where customers are charged at cutoff; refunds working normally

entities.name: Star
entities.context: System that could potentially pass UIDs or CIDs to customer agents

entities.name: RabbitMQ
entities.context: Message queue system potentially used by error reporting tab for older refund method

entities.name: C@C
entities.context: Abbreviation for Charge at Checkout experiment mentioned in meeting title

results.meeting_purpose: Review and finalize the 2026 Yearly Plan for the Consumer Mega-Alliance, focusing on Q1 priorities and strategic initiatives

decisions.what: Create AOV-focused squad in Q2 with dedicated KPI, self-funded
decisions.context: Focus in Q1 is to roll out new personalized core journey including widgets, then layer in upselling components

decisions.what: Reserve 20% of engineering IC capacity for legacy loyalty program maintenance while evolving new loyalty framework
decisions.context: Implementing new vendor-based loyalty program launching first in US

decisions.what: Pause Programs on Factor funnel for peak due to negative results
decisions.context: Will partner with Commercial and New Programs hire in NA to design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships in Q2

decisions.what: Decouple forecasting from personalization models
decisions.context: Define technical interfaces enabling independent iteration, assess org impact in Q1-Q2

decisions.what: Defer Variable Pricing to Q3, added to Market Innovation squad backlog
decisions.context: Urgently requested by markets but will define long-term ownership before initiation as pricing ownership moves to growth MA

action_items.task: Clarify integration of menu expansion plans, personalization rollouts, and app features
Roll out Elysium (new store and homepage in app) followed by new app features
Prioritize P500 readiness and Penguin for Factor US menu ranking rollout
Expand Penguin personalization to INTL markets (HF-UK, HF-CA, CP-CA, HF-ANZ, HF-BNL, HF-DKSE, HF-DEAT)
Share prioritization framework for Project 5M
Define technical interfaces for decoupling forecasting from personalization models
Reconcile marketing RAF plan with tech YP and strengthen Refer-a-Friend program
Sign off on Factor requirements integration into Market Innovation backlog
Merge Factor backlog with Market Innovation squad list
Design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships for Factor
Prepare one-pager summarizing Project 5M prioritization framework

key_points: Elysium rollout includes new store/homepage in app with merchandising widgets, recommendation widgets, search functionality, and trending/popular widgets
Menu ranking rollout prioritizes P500 readiness and Penguin for Factor US, with INTL expansion following
Project 5M prioritization revealed behavioral gap: users save recipes enthusiastically but rarely act on them, leading to recipe bridge prioritization
Share squad focusing on RAF program improvements and new in-product sharing loops for organic growth
Loyalty strategy involves maintaining legacy program while implementing new vendor-based program starting in US
Factor tech requests have been collected and integrated into Market Innovation backlog
Variable pricing is urgently requested by markets but deferred to H2/Q3
blockers: Gap between Marketing and Consumer growth targets for RAF program
Factor Programs showing negative results during peak
Need to define long-term ownership for Variable Pricing before initiation
Pricing ownership currently moving to growth MA creating uncertainty
follow_ups: Walk through detailed methodology for Project 5M prioritization if requested
Assess organizational impact of decoupled forecasting in Q1-Q2
Define long-term ownership for Variable Pricing before Q3 initiation
Update FAQ 11 regarding RAF program alignment
Further alignment on topics/ordering pending with Tushar and Holger

entities.name: AOV squad
entities.context: New self-funded squad to be created in Q2 with dedicated KPI focused on average order value

results.meeting_purpose: Review and finalize the 2026 Yearly Plan for Consumer Mega-Alliance Q1, addressing draft feedback and aligning on strategic priorities

decisions.what: Create AOV-focused squad in Q2 with dedicated KPI, self-funded
decisions.context: Focus in Q1 is to roll out new personalized core journey including widgets, then layer in upselling components

decisions.what: Reserve 20% of engineering IC capacity for legacy loyalty program maintenance while implementing new vendor-based loyalty program
decisions.context: New loyalty program to launch first in the US

decisions.what: Decouple forecasting from personalization models with independent technical interfaces
decisions.context: Once validated, assess organizational impact in Q1-Q2

decisions.what: Pause Programs on Factor funnel for peak due to negative results
decisions.context: Will partner with Commercial and New Programs hire in NA to design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships in Q2

decisions.what: Defer variable pricing to Q3, added to Market Innovation squad backlog
decisions.context: Will define long-term ownership before initiation as pricing ownership is moving to growth MA

decisions.what: Prioritize recipe bridge feature in Q4/Q1 for Project 5M
decisions.context: Based on behavioral gap: users save recipes enthusiastically but rarely act on them, indicating high desire for inspiration but friction in execution

action_items.task: Share prioritization framework for Project 5M
Define technical interfaces for decoupling forecasting from personalization models
Sign off on Factor requirements integration
Roll out Elysium (new store and homepage in app)
action_items.timeline: Fast rollout with new app features

action_items.task: Roll out menu ranking models prioritizing P500 readiness
Expedite Penguin for INTL markets after P500
Strengthen RAF program and build new in-product sharing loops
Design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships for Factor
action_items.owner: Alison Ryan with Commercial and New Programs hire

action_items.task: Define long-term ownership for variable pricing

key_points: Integration of menu expansion plans, personalization rollouts, and app features through Elysium and menu ranking models
Project 5M prioritization based on user behavior analysis showing gap between recipe saving and execution
Reconciliation of marketing RAF plan with tech yearly plan to address growth target gaps
Factor requirements fully integrated into Market Innovation backlog
Variable pricing identified as urgently requested feature by markets
Loyalty strategy differentiation between legacy program maintenance and new vendor-based program
Menu ranking rollout prioritizes P500 readiness and Penguin for Factor US, with INTL markets following
blockers: Gap between Marketing and Consumer growth targets for RAF program
Negative results from Programs on Factor funnel requiring pause during peak
Need to define long-term ownership for variable pricing as pricing ownership transitions to growth MA
Technical dependencies making RAF program difficult to optimize
follow_ups: Detailed methodology walkthrough for Project 5M prioritization framework if requested
Organizational impact assessment after forecasting/personalization decoupling validation in Q1-Q2
Loyalty Strategy SMT Shareout review
Forecasting Domain Boundaries documentation review
Updated FAQ 11 for RAF program alignment
